verses.verse: (Luke 1:3, 4) That I may make you know the certainty of the words of truth, (Prov. 25:13; 1 Pet. 3:15) That you may answer words of truth To those who send to you?
Do not rob the (Ex. 23:6; Job 31:16-21; Zech. 7:10) poor because he is poor, Nor oppress the afflicted at the gate;
(1 Sam. 24:12; Ps. 12:5; 140:12) For the LORD will plead their cause, And plunder the soul of those who plunder them.
Make no friendship with an angry man, And with a (Prov. 29:22) furious man do not go,
Lest you learn his ways And set a snare for your soul.
(Prov. 11:15) Do not be one of those who shakes hands in a pledge, One of those who is surety for debts;
If you have nothing with which to pay, Why should he take away your bed from under you?
(Deut. 19:14; 27:17; Job 24:2; Prov. 23:10) Do not remove the ancient landmark Which your fathers have set.
Do you see a man who excels in his work? He will stand before kings; He will not stand before unknown men.
When you sit down to eat with a ruler, Consider carefully what is before you;
And put a knife to your throat If you are a man given to appetite.
Do not desire his delicacies, For they are deceptive food.
((Prov. 28:20; Matt. 6:19; 1 Tim. 6:9, 10; Heb. 13:5)) Do not overwork to be rich; (Rom. 12:16) Because of your own understanding, cease!
Will you set your eyes on that which is not? For riches certainly make themselves wings; They fly away like an eagle toward heaven.
Do not eat the bread of (Deut. 15:9; Prov. 28:22) a miser, Nor desire his delicacies;
For as he thinks in his heart, so is he. “Eat and drink!” (Prov. 12:2) he says to you, But his heart is not with you.
The morsel you have eaten, you will vomit up, And waste your pleasant words.
(Prov. 9:8; Matt. 7:6) Do not speak in the hearing of a fool, For he will despise the wisdom of your words.
Do not remove the ancient landmark, Nor enter the fields of the fatherless;
(Prov. 22:23) For their Redeemer is mighty; He will plead their cause against you.
Apply your heart to instruction, And your ears to words of knowledge.
(Prov. 13:24) Do not withhold correction from a child, For if you beat him with a rod, he will not die.
You shall beat him with a rod, And deliver his soul from hell.
My son, if your heart is wise, My heart will rejoice—indeed, I myself;
Yes, my inmost being will rejoice When your lips speak right things.
(Ps. 37:1; Prov. 24:1, 19) Do not let your heart envy sinners, But (Prov. 28:14) be zealous for the fear of the LORD all the day;
((Ps. 37:37)) For surely there is a hereafter, And your hope will not be cut off.
Hear, my son, and be wise; And guide your heart in the way.
(Prov. 20:1; 23:29, 30; Is. 5:22; Matt. 24:49; (Luke 21:34); Rom. 13:13; (Eph. 5:18)) Do not mix with winebibbers, Or with gluttonous eaters of meat;
For the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty, And drowsiness will clothe a man with rags.
(Prov. 1:8; Eph. 6:1) Listen to your father who begot you, And do not despise your mother when she is old.
(Prov. 4:7; 18:15; (Matt. 13:44)) Buy the truth, and do not sell it, Also wisdom and instruction and understanding.
(Prov. 10:1) The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice, And he who begets a wise child will delight in him.
Let your father and your mother be glad, And let her who bore you rejoice.
My son, give me your heart, And let your eyes observe my ways.
